solution_line_template: The amount of money they currently make in a year is {months_per_year} * {monthly_sales} = $<<{months_per_year}*{monthly_sales}={current_annual_sales}>>{current_annual_sales}.

The additional amount they need to make is ${target_annual_sales} - ${current_annual_sales}= $<<{target_annual_sales}-{current_annual_sales}={additional_annual_sales_needed}>>{additional_annual_sales_needed} per year.

So, they should make ${additional_annual_sales_needed} / {months_per_year} = $<<{additional_annual_sales_needed}/{months_per_year}={additional_monthly_sales_needed}>>{additional_monthly_sales_needed} more every month.
